column5: Hi folks, Haven't posted for awhile since i have'nt fished for nearly 5 months.  Was able to get out Friday night for little softwater on L.Ontario. It's quite physically brutal and dangerous to do this, but 5 months was too long to go without trolling or casting. The hard work usually pays off with some results. This night brought too many OOS bass and some brown trout. Here is some pics Trolling on a pitch black cool night.  Some browns, nice little scrappers made it all good.    Too many of these today since they are out of season. What you can catch can really vary in L.Ontario.   Cheers, ehg
good goin were you guys fishing the north shore
Nice looking fish WTG  rob
you are a brave soul! Thanks for sharing.
Oh Baby, almost time to start dragging some of the new baits.....and, Nice Report!
Gotta luv soft water reports from Ontario in February !!  Thanks for the moral booster and well done on some very  nice fish
Dude that's hardcore!!!! I assume you had to drag the boat across the beach since everything is frozen. Thumbs up!
Hats off to you, Extreme Hardcore Guy  Amazing how many you caught too!

I wish it was as easy as dragging the boat across a beach. Had to dig steps (with shovel) down a cliff and carry the boat and equipment, then go back up after. No beach just ice covered rocks and snow/ice formations to deal with to launch.  Usually it pays off with great fishing. Need sustained northerly winds or its a no go. Some different species from last time i went here a year or so ago. Tons of big white bass were caught a year ago.  Some walleye  Usually catch sheeepshead   Never knowing what will be caught is some of the fun. None of the above fish were caught yesterday and vice-versa. Always a variety, have caught rainbows, chinooks, carp (hitting lures), seen musky caught, etc... in winter here. Hard work but good times  cheers,  ehg
saweeeet - very jealous!  Nice going - gotta love warm water outflows!  Cheers, UF

I clicked on this topic assuming I'd see a shore fishing report...then I saw your in a boat, Sweet! Awesome fish, especially In January, who'da thunk it. I think its time I get out there and go for some of those browns.  -Ben
Hardcore!
very cool, soft water, u are the envy of many man right now

W O W !!!!!    5 months . no wonder , it would have taken that long to muster-up that much gusto to get out and do that survivor series audition.  cohonies like grapefruits.  awesome post . thanks for sharin'.   what next , the falls in a barrel?
What a diehard

Great fishing trip guys !!!.  ..nice browns & a big smallie !!!.  .well done,we used to fish there all winter long from shore when it was allowed,it was some of the best fishing i ever had in my life...cheers
Thats awesome, thanks for sharing!  Gives hope to us all, even those of us who aren't nearly brave enough to do anything before ice out in April
Your a brave man.  Great Report!

Thanks for replies! Just wanted to share this experience. Fishindevil, likewise its usually the best fish catching i've had in my life.   Have done these reports a few times before, but i always post with trepidation. I really advise against trying this type of fishing. One little problem with engine or winds, currents etc could be your demise. This sign over my shoulder explains it clearly.    Had a great time despite the hard work and ever present fear.  ehg
That could be the biggest white bass I have ever seen!  Wow, it pays to be hard core!  good stuff.

Amazing report!  You really braved the elements to pursue the sport! You got to be real careful out there especially this time of year. Can you imagine what everyone would be saying about you though if something bad had happened? But wow, what a great haul!
Well, I know what I'm doing next weekend!  Awesome report!
great report EHG, I'm going to try some of those areas when the boat comes out of storage in 35 days. Hopefully all the shore ice is gone by then. thanks for posting.

Thanks again for further replies! Mikeh, sunrise or sunset are best time since the sun and clear water make them spooky during the day. Being a warm water outflow it draws fish from big lake between late Nov. until April. Medium sized Shad Raps and Rattlin' Raps in blu/slv/org have worked the best there for last 15+ yrs.  cheers,  ehg
